title: Simple FontForge question
content:
I’m using FontForge version 20080203 and adding a single glyph to Futura Book (Bitstream version, which has no editable embedding restrictions), but upon TTF generation, I can no longer embed the font in a PDF.

Two questions: 1) where are the embedding/editable embedding flags set in FontForge, and 2) how can I find out if this is against Bitstream’s EULA? I’m not selling or distributing the font, it’s merely to be able to use a specific bullet in the same form field as Futura Book.

 [‹ Rounded corners script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165203/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42124 "Go to previous forum topic") [combining accents unicode question ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165203/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42374 "Go to next forum topic")
author: RedMonolith

comments.content: Answered my own question. I changed the encoding back to ANSI and changed the settings under Element \> Font Info \> OS/2. Works great.
